<!-- Please use this template while reporting a bug and provide as much info as possible. Not doing so may result in your bug not being addressed in a timely manner. Thanks!

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/
-->


**What happened**:
When referencing init container's env value from its fields, kubelet complains `"Error: container <initContainerNmae> not found"`

**What you expected to happen**:
Init container should be supported to get env values from its own fields, as [it is designed](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/init-containers/#differences-from-regular-containers) to 

> ... support all the fields and features of app Containers ...

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
1. create a pod with init container refering its fields value as env value 
kubectl create -f test-pod-1.yaml
```
# file test-pod-1.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: test-pod-1
spec:
  containers:
  - args:
    - sh
    - -c
    - sleep 10000000001
    image: busybox
    name: weblogic-ms
  initContainers:
  - args:
    - sh
    - -c
    - sleep 10000000001
    env:
    - name: TOS_CPU_REQUEST
      valueFrom:
        resourceFieldRef:
          containerName: volumeinit
          divisor: "0"
          resource: requests.cpu
    image: busybox
    name: volumeinit
    resources:
      limits:
        cpu: "1"
        memory: 2Gi
      requests:
        cpu: 500m
        memory: 1Gi
```
2. pod cannot be created 
```
$ kubectl get pod test-pod-1 
NAME         READY   STATUS                            RESTARTS   AGE
test-pod-1   0/1     Init:CreateContainerConfigError   0          93s
```
3. check pod events 
```
$ kubectl describe pod test-pod-1 | grep Event -A 10 
Events:
  Type     Reason     Age                 From                           Message
  ----     ------     ----                ----                           -------
  Normal   Scheduled  2m3s                default-scheduler              Successfully assigned default/test-pod-1 to kind-1-control-plane
  Normal   Pulling    11s (x6 over 2m2s)  kubelet, kind-1-control-plane  pulling image "busybox"
  Normal   Pulled     11s (x5 over 94s)   kubelet, kind-1-control-plane  Successfully pulled image "busybox"
  Warning  Failed     11s (x5 over 94s)   kubelet, kind-1-control-plane  Error: container volumeinit not found
```
**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
$ kubectl version 
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"13", GitVersion:"v1.13.1", GitCommit:"eec55b9ba98609a46fee712359c7b5b365bdd920", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-12-13T10:39:04Z", GoVersion:"go1.11.2", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"12", GitVersion:"v1.12.2", GitCommit:"17c77c7898218073f14c8d573582e8d2313dc740", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-11-08T00:23:22Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.4", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g: `cat /etc/os-release`):
```
$cat /etc/os-release 
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION="18.04.1 LTS (Bionic Beaver)"
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS"

HOME_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/"

PRIVACY_POLICY_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy"
VERSION_CODENAME=bionic
UBUNTU_CODENAME=bionic
```
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
```
$ docker exec -ti a369ddf016af uname -a
Linux kind-1-control-plane 4.15.0-45-generic #48~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Tue Jan 29 18:03:48 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```

- Others:
